result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dylon J Lauritsen was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Balance of fine, costs and fees shall be paid at a rate of $100 per month commencing 4-01-16 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State. Defendant has successfully completed TAD Program.  Statements by DA and Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Due to a conflict on the Court's calendar, 1-13-16 Sentencing hearing rescheduled to 2-03-16 at 1:15 p.m.
1-13-16 Sentencing hearing removed from Court's calendar and to be rescheduled; case miscalendared.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Defendant enrolledi n TAD, offer from DA received and accepted.  Defendant is also in in-patient treatment; On a plea to Ct. 1, State will move to dismiss and read in Ct. 2; w/ TAD 8 days jail w/ huber, fine of $1442; blood draw fee of  $33.60, 14 mos DLR/IID upon licensure, AODA; no tad 30 days jail w/ huber.  Colloquy w/ Defendant; Defendant waives right to counsel, Court accepts waiver; Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1; On motion of the State, Court dismisses Ct 2 for read in.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Sentencing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def appeared in person.   Intern Samuel Tufford and Atty Mandy Schepper appeared for State. Plea hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.
